availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William F. White (Fayette County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married Elizabeth Fox White in Madison County, Kentucky on February 29, 1844. Father of Daniel White, Charles White, Nannie White, Amelia White, and James White. Hotel keeper in Richmond, Kentucky in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Richmond, Kentucky in 1850. Merchant in Lexington, Kentucky in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Lexington, Kentucky in 1860. Enrolled for military duty in Seventh District of Kentucky on July 1, 1863 (U.S.A).

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 239.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 402.Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, p. 4.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, p. 451.Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County, Kentucky, Madison County Marriages, Film #001944390, p.73Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Fayette County, KY, July 1863, p. 123, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
